intro: Scabiosa ucranica var. sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian scabious, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Italy. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
